column4: How Ubuntu handles new packages in Debian which has older version number?
For example, a package is 20060101-1 in Ubuntu but 0.0.20070101 in Debian..
you could install, but its a debian pacakge and may not run correctly
I mean how Ubuntu sync from Debian if that happens?
a package was in Ubuntu has version "20060101-1" but Debian now maintain it too and use "0.0.20070101-1" for version number...
Ubuntu sync from Debian sid periodically...I think..
hmm maybe, i just assumed they build their own pacakges
hes going to comment out the cdrom in the file
if that package was not in Ubuntu, sync is easy..
